TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable PeerContact extends System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer implements class System.IEquatable`1<class System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact>, class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Public Class PeerContact Inherits Peer Implements IEquatable(Of PeerContact), ISerializable
type PeerContact = class inherit Peer interface IEquatable<PeerContact> interface ISerializable

summary.span: 表示用户已检索其扩展信息的对等方。

span.span: Represents a peer for which a user has retrieved extended information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 联系人表示受信任的对等方。A contact represents a trusted peer. 一个必须为远程对等方创建对象或"网络邻居"范围之外时，与远程对等方协作的用户。A object must be created for a remote peer or for a user to collaborate with the remote peer when it is outside of the "People Near Me" scope. 一个对象可以作为任一的远程计算机或用户的远程计算机上运行的应用程序存在。A object can exist as either an application running on a remote computer, or the user of a remote computer. 可以将此类的实例添加到该页将联系信息存储在持久的方式。An instance of this class can be added to the which stores the contact information in a persistent manner. 从应用程序邀请进行身份验证和加密。An application invitation from a is both authenticated and encrypted. 若要接受或拒绝的对等联系人的邀请的用户界面对话框还指示邀请方是受信任。The UI dialog to accept or reject an invitation from a peer contact also indicates that that the inviter is trusted. 订阅对象意味着远程对等方可以查看其已注册的应用程序、 对象和状态显示信息。Subscribing to a object means a remote peer can see its registered applications, objects and presence information. 璹綷，调用方必须登录到对等方协作基础结构通过或通过 Windows UI 已登录。To subscribe to a , the caller must be signed in to the peer collaboration infrastructure via or signed in via the Windows UI. 所有其他操作不需要登录。All other operations do not require sign-in.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可能使用的显示名称来区分中的联系人实例中其中可能有多个电子邮件地址，或者如果有多个对等方具有相同的显示名称。A display name may be used to differentiate contacts in a in instances where a may have multiple email addresses, or if there are multiple peers with the same display name.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources and optionally releases the managed resources used by the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当离开协作会话，将不再需要某些对象。When a leaves a collaboration session, certain objects are no longer required. 如果该联系人必须与不能直接注册到对等主机中的任何其他终结点已进行协作并希望继续与其协作主机，主机必须注册这些终结点，应用程序中或在其之前释放此对象。If this contact had been collaborating with any other endpoint(s) not directly registered with the peer host, and the host expects to continue to collaborate with them, the host must register those endpoints within an application or within its before disposing of this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个对象用于表示邮件地址。A object is used to represent the mail address. 联系人管理器允许在一个实例内的多个电子邮件地址。The Contact Manager allows for multiple email addresses within one instance. 此属性的默认值为 `null`。The default value for this property is `null`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 要传递为应从获取参数的字符串。The string to pass as the parameter should be obtained from . 此类旨在为简单的 XML 对象模型，用于协作基础结构，而不是针对作为常规的 XML 对象模型使用的轻量实现。This class is intended to be a lightweight implementation of a simple XML object model for use within the collaboration infrastructure, and not for use as a general XML object model.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果调用对等方未订阅与指定关联调用此方法之前，必须调用方法。If the calling peer is not subscribed to the associated with the specified the method must be called prior to calling this method. 而调用方不需要在登录到协作基础结构才能成功完成，此方法在成功调用或某个方法必须已完成时调用方之前登录。While the caller is not required to sign-in to the collaboration infrastructure for this method to complete successfully, a successful call to or one of the methods must have been completed while the caller was previously signed in. 此功能仅公开上类。This functionality is only exposed on the class. 任何其他类型的对等方出于安全原因不会公开此功能。This functionality is not exposed on any other type of peer for security reasons.

span.span: - The calling peer is not subscribed to the .

exception.span: - 调用对等方尚未调用 方法。

span.span: - The calling peer has not yet called the method.
Unable to complete operation.

span.para: 调用此方法需要的。对等方协作会话开始时，将创建此状态。
Calling this method requires a of . This state is created when the peer collaboration session begins.

summary.span: 发送加入由发送方发起的对等方协作活动的邀请。

span.span: Sends an invitation to join into peer collaboration activity sponsored by the sender.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用方不需要登录到才能成功完成此方法的基础结构。The caller is not required to sign-in to the infrastructure for this method to complete successfully. 一个从受邀请的人不是受邀请的人接受邀请协作相同。A from the invitee is not the same as the invitee accepting the invitation to collaborate. 如果邀请发送到未安装该应用程序的远程对等，邀请会自动拒绝。If an invitation is sent to a remote peer that has not installed the application, the invitation is automatically declined.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSubscribed As Boolean
public: property bool IsSubscribed { bool get(); };

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指定当前 是已订阅终结点，还是已取消对终结点的订阅。

span.span: Gets or sets a value specifying whether the current is subscribed or unsubscribed to an endpoint.

summary.span: 此属性还会获取或设置另一个值，该值指定当前对等主机或宿主应用程序是已订阅此 ，还是已取消对它的订阅。

span.span: Alternatively, this property gets or sets a value specifying whether the current peer host or hosting application has subscribed or unsubscribed to this .

value.span: 如果此 已订阅此终结点，则为 ；如果联系人尚未订阅或已取消订阅，则为 。

span.span: if this is subscribed to this endpoint, if the contact has not subscribed or has unsubscribed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在许多情况下，不同时，作为对等主机。In many instances, a is not the same as a peer host. 对等主机具有内的实例的远程对等方，并且关系是它们已邀请的对等方协作。A peer host has an instance within the of the remote peer, and the relationship is that they have invited the peer to collaborate. 终结点有"Me"实例在其自己的联系人管理器和对等主机，但未指定的关系。An endpoint has a "Me" instance within its own contact manager and the peer host, but the relationship is not specified. 如果对等主机处于，并对等联系人选择不这样做，将其被阻塞，而不是从主机联系人管理器中删除其条目可以具有的值。If the peer host is in the , and the peer contact chooses not to , its can have a value of blocked, rather than deleting its entry from the host Contact Manager. 没有本地对等方、 远程对等节点、 对等主机和订阅之间的多对多关系。There is a many-to-many relationship between local peers, remote peers, peer hosts, and subscriptions. 订阅是每个用户，而不是每个进程、 每个应用程序，或每个域。Subscriptions are per user, rather than per process, per application, or per domain. 因此，订阅与对象是已订阅的联系人的列表，并从其它需要更新。Consequently, the subscriptions associated with a object are the list of contacts to which it has subscribed and from which it expects updates. 这些联系人要么已更新其自己的应用程序、 对象和状态显示信息，或它们已更新有关中的联系人信息。Those contacts either have updated their own application, object, and presence information, or they have updated information regarding contacts in the . 此属性始终返回`true`的对象是否表示本地计算机或"Me"联系人，因为联系人始终会订阅本身。This property always returns `true` if the object is a which represents the local or "Me" contact, since a contact is always subscribed to itself.

span.span: This object has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Nickname { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Nickname : string with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个字符串，该字符串表示 的 。

span.span: Gets or sets a string which represents the of the .
which represents the nickname of the .
The default value for this property is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可用于一个昵称对象有多个对等方具有相同的显示名称的情况下。A Nickname can be used for a object in case there are multiple peers with the same display name. 协作会话还可以使用别名来指定远程对等节点通常在更大的协作工作中使用。A collaboration session can also use the nickname to designate remote peers commonly used in larger collaboration efforts.

span.span: This object has been disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序更改发生时启动，在注册或注销协作基础结构从应用程序。Application changes occur when an application is launched, registered or unregistered from the collaboration infrastructure. 它们也发生时对等方加入或离开协作会话或更改网络终结点位置。They also occur when peers join or leave a collaboration session or change network endpoint locations. 对等作用域更改还可能会影响应用程序中的更改。Peer scope changes may also effect a change in an application. 从此类继承的类可以重写此方法以在事件发生时执行其他任务。Classes that inherit from this class can override this method to perform additional tasks when the event occurs.

span.para: 在派生类中，一定要调用此方法的基类实现，以便已注册的委托接收事件。
In a derived class, be sure to call the base class implementation of this method so that registered delegates receive the event.
